newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Varig mulls cargo surcharge ex-Netherlands.
newsitem.headline: Varig mulls cargo surcharge ex-Netherlands.

text.p: Varig Brazilian Airlines will be putting a fuel surcharge in place from the Netherlands, following sharply on the heels of one it has implemented in Germany, said the carrier's Dutch manager, Dirk Hazenoot.
The Brazilian carrier has not yet decided on the exact amount but Hazenoot estimates that it will be in line with other recent rises.
KLM, the Dutch national carrier, has already implemented a 20 Dutch cents per kilo surcharge.

Varig buys space on Dutch charter and cargo carrier, Martinair's twice-weekly flights to Sao Paulo. Hazenoot said Varig and Martinair had not yet decided how to implement increases from the Netherlands to Sao Paulo.
Martinair announced cargo rates increases of between five to ten percent depending on the route.
Varig tends to follow the national carriers, he added. In Germany the carrier followed Lufthansa and introduced a 15 pfennig rise.

Hazenoot called for more clarity regarding the surcharge implementation. "There is a lot of confusion in the market, it would be better if all of the carriers agreed on a fuel surcharge and implemented it at the same time." - Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542-7706 Fax+44 171 542-5017
